intro: Stelis compressicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial epiphytic plant native to Southeast Asia, including countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant features slender, compressed stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a pale green or white coloration. Stelis compressicaulis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on tree trunks or in rocky crevices.
